Experience.Title: Software Engineer Intern
Messages: Created an archiving and file copying system that interfaced with OpenStack Swift
Worked on a image editor using WPF and Pixel Shaders
Created a website that consumed proprietary gridline processing data and displayed reports to administators

Experience.Title: Imaging Production Team Lead
Messages: Developed a WPF application for specialists to track images and statistical information using a SQL database
Developed multiple WinForms applications to accomplish minor image processing and file manipulations
Supported the office manager in maintaining the production floor
Had many opportunities to train employees as well as give presentations
Led the team in production numbers in addition to performing administrative tasks

Experience.Title: Imaging Specialist
Messages: Handled historical documents and images and prepared them for publishing
Was the top image producer in the department and learned how to troubleshoot the hardware and the software

Experience.Title: Technical Support Agent
Messages: Became familiar with Ancestry products and supported customers having technical problems
Learned more about Ancestry’s mission and gained insight into customers’ feelings about our products

Group.Name: C
Group.Details: My systems classes used C at times. I am less familiar with C as I am C++ but feel comfortable enough in C to be competent.

Group.Name: C++
Group.Details: My beginner classes as well as my systems classes were all done in C++. I am familiar with Makefiles, GCC and the object-oriented concepts as they are done in C++. I have no experience with the Boost library but am comfortable writing in C++.

Group.Name: C#
Group.Details: Ancestry uses C# in almost all of its development. I am extremely familiar with Visual Studio and would say that C# is my most comfortable language.

Group.Name: Java
Group.Details: My earlier classes used Java extensively and so I am familiar with Java though it is not a language I would choose to write a project in given the choice. I used IntelliJ as my default editor so I am comfortable with its environment.

Group.Name: AngularJS
Group.Details: This website uses AngularJS as its front-end. I also wrote another site called broadcasts using AngularJS.

Group.Name: CSS
Group.Details: I am most comfortable using CSS frameworks like UIKit and Twitter Bootstrap. I can write plain CSS if needed but I use frameworks for my own work because of the ease-of-use and speed they provide. This site uses Twitter Bootstrap.

Group.Name: HTML
Group.Details: I am comfortable writing HTML and use it to describe my page and not simply lay out the content the way I wish.

Group.Name: JavaScript
Group.Details: I have written multiple intranet sites used by Ancestry that have JavaScript functionality. I am most familiar with JQuery to manipulate the DOM but have used plain JavaScript in some scenarios to accomplish certain UI tasks.

Group.Name: Node.js
Group.Details: This website uses a Node.js back-end web server which I wrote. I have also done some scripting in Node.js as well as a few other back-end servers for school and personal projects.

Group.Name: Python
Group.Details: Multiple classes I have taken were done primarily in Python. I am quite comfortable in this language and have done extensive scripting.

Group.Name: Ruby
Group.Details: I have contributed to a Ruby open source project called syrup which is used as a service to extract bank information. I have also done some minor scripting in Ruby.

Group.Name: MongoDB
Group.Details: I have used MongoDB for school assignments as well as some personal projects. I have done two (one, and two) in-depth research assignments on MongoDB and how it compares to other databases.

Group.Name: MySQL
Group.Details: Ancestry switched from SQL Server to MySQL so I was able to learn about the differences between the two and how to interface with and use MySQL.

Group.Name: SQLite
Group.Details: I have used SQLite for quite a few personal projects. We also use SQLite at Ancestry as a way to send information back and forth between us and our vendors. We also built a recipe based system for managing operations performed on a collection of images.

Group.Name: SQL Server
Group.Details: I used this at Ancestry. All of the legacy data up until 2014 was stored in Microsoft SQL Server instances.

Group.Name: Kanban
Group.Details: I use Kanban for my personal projects and the team projects I have done in school.

Group.Name: Scrum
Group.Details: I participated in a Scrum team during my most recent time at Ancestry.

Group.Name: Git
Group.Details: I use Git for all of my version control. I use it every day and manage my private repositories, which primarily consists of school assignments, on BitBucket and host all of my other projects on GitHub.

Group.Name: OpenStack
Group.Details: I created a file copying and management system that interfaces with an OpenStack Swift cluster. The system essentially allowed users to use the Swift cluster as if it were a file system.

Group.Name: WPF
Group.Details: I have written quite a few applications using WPF. A couple of these have been very large scale applications and I would say that I am very proficient in writing WPF applications

Courses.Name: Algorithm Analysis
Courses.Details: Discussed and implemented various algorithm strategies and the math behind them. We specifically implemented divide and conquer, linear programming, dynamic programming and various search algorithms.

Courses.Name: Calculus 1 - Differential Calculus
Courses.Details: Learned how to derive all linear and continuous equations.

Courses.Name: Calculus 2 - Integral Calculus
Courses.Details: Learned various strategies for integration and also learned about common sequences and series.

Courses.Name: Computational and Probabilistic Models
Courses.Details: Discussed the theory and history of computation. We learned about finite state machines, grammars, turing models, and algorithm complexity (specifically what makes something an NP problem vs a P problem.

Courses.Name: Discrete Structures and Mathematics
Courses.Details: Learned boolean and relational algebra.

Courses.Name: Elementary Linear Algebra
Courses.Details: Learned how to perform various operations on matricies and how to do proofs.

Courses.Name: Newtonian Mechanics
Courses.Details: Experimented with and learned about basic Newtonian physics.

Courses.Name: Principles of Statistics
Courses.Details: Learned the basics about statistics and what is required to perform a statistically sound study including the math required.

Courses.Name: Advanced Programming Concepts
Courses.Details: Was introduced to design patterns, made a medium scale program that interacted with a database and had a server and client architecture.

Courses.Name: Computer Systems
Courses.Details: This was a systems class and introduced me to low-level machine architecture and programming. We programmed in assembler and C.

Courses.Name: Concepts of Programming Languages
Courses.Details: Learned what features good programming languages possess. We implemented many aspects of a programming language such as the parser, closures, garbage collection and type checking.

Courses.Name: Data Structures
Courses.Details: Was introduced to basic data structures and implemented many of them. We implemented linked lists, stacks, queues and binary search trees.

Courses.Name: Interactive Graphics and Image Processing
Courses.Details: Learned about two-dimensional graphics programming.

Courses.Name: Internet Programming
Courses.Details: Learned about the architecture of the Internet and implemented socket programs, basic web servers and then made a web site using modern design principles.

Courses.Name: Software Design and Testing
Courses.Details: Implemented a large-scale version of the Settlers of Catan game as a web application while learning about design patterns and good testing practices.

Courses.Name: Software Engineering
Courses.Details: Worked on a team that consisted of various jobs for everyone in the class. This simulated a real software development team including managers, developers, testers, and marketers.

Courses.Name: Big Data Mining
Courses.Details: Used Hadoop to perform data mining operations on massive data sets. Conducted a study using data gathered from Steam's public API.

Courses.Name: Computer Communications and Networking
Courses.Details: Learned about the Internet's architecture and implemented TCP.

Courses.Name: Computer Security
Courses.Details: Learned about various encryption algorithms and about common computer vulnerabilities. Performed attacks on programs and systems that exhibit these vulnerabilities.

Courses.Name: Ethics and Computers in Society
Courses.Details: Discussed the history of the Software Development industry and the ethics regarding various decisions that software professionals make.

Courses.Name: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
Courses.Details: Implemented several Artificial Intelligence algorithms and created AI bots that could compete in a simulated environment.

Courses.Name: Machine Learning and Data Mining
Courses.Details: Learned about neural networks, decision trees, data mining and clustering.

Courses.Name: Technical Communication and Writing
Courses.Details: Learned how to convey ideas and write in a technical setting. Conducted presentations and created users manuals for technical materials.

Courses.Name: Communication in an Organizational Setting
Courses.Details: Learned about grammar usage and sentence structure to improve writing. Learned how to communicate in a professional setting.

Courses.Name: Economics: Principles and Problems
Courses.Details: Learned the basic principles of macro and micro economics.

Courses.Name: Marketing Management
Courses.Details: Discussed strategies for marketing products. We learned what large companies do to market as well as small start-ups.

Courses.Name: Principles of Accounting
Courses.Details: Learned the basic principles of accounting including the formulae needed to perform basic accounting.

Courses.Name: Principles of Finance
Courses.Details: Discussed corporate finances and learned about stocks, bonds, and annuities

Courses.Name: Principles of Statistics
Courses.Details: Learned the basics about statistics and what is required to perform a statistically sound study including the math required.
